column4: Hi, I was upgrading Ubuntu 9.10 to 10.04 and my system froze at about 85% of the upgrade process, so I had no other option to reboot, and when I did, my windows partition is gone and I cant access it, and Ubuntu 10.04 wont load
Yes, grub loads, but my windows partition isnt shown, and the linux partition loads up 10.04 which never will get past the load screen
you mean windows isn't listed in the grub menu?
I would try some recovery stuff with a livecd, starting with recovering grub
What recovery stuff, what livecd, how do i recover grub
basically, are there any selections you can make in the grub menu to boot?
Yes, they are all linux partitions I think, I can check if you want (the comp in question is upstairs)
ya, you should check, otherwise you will have to go the livecd route
wildbat: I can boot into recovery mode

wildbat: I dont know whats going on, because I boot into recovery mode, and I see this menu, and when I press the down arrow key to go through the menu options, it just starts loading ubuntu 10.04 instead, which is stuck on load
I don't know, and wildcat left  :(
I would try anything you can to get any sort of boot
